title: Witching Week
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week thirteen that has set up quite the sweat for the final week of the regular season. We are now in the week when playoffs become consolation and consolation becomes playoffs.

Week Thirteen Recap

Team Ross vs Team Horses:

Prediction: Team Horses by 12.4

Reality: Team Ross by 9.52

“Always love playing folbe love that guy” - Aross

“Nice of Alex to finally get a win he somewhat deserved. Emphasis on somewhat” - Folbe

I Got a Half Chubb vs Team ACL Tear:

Prediction: Team ACL Tear by 15.6

Reality: Team ACL Tear by 15.8

“Unfortunate that my boys just have to keep going off. Let's save it” - JL

“Jonah has a nice team” - CJ

Nooni vs Mike Williams WR1:

Prediction: Nooni by 6.7

Reality: Mike Williams WR1 by 20.8

“My matchup last week didn’t matter” - Nooni

“Ran nooni off the field, as expected” - Brad

Real Brothers vs United Nations:

Prediction: Real Brothers by 3.3

Reality: United Nations by 23.08

“A good win at a little needed time” - MW

“Oof. A bad loss at a much needed time. Sorry boys” - Jart

NN vs CalAmari Cooper:

Prediction: CalAmari Cooper by 11.5

Reality: NN by 12.18

“Only half of dmich’s prediction came true last week” - NN

“NN clapped me, then he beat me in fantasy” - Dmichs

GRIDDY GANG vs Pray for Ridley:

Prediction: Pray for Ridley by 5.4

Reality: GRIDDY GANG by 6.58

“Good effort from griddy but rest of my guys fell short” - Jase

“Congrats Jason rooting for you” - Bank

Real Brothers: 345 yards / 0 TDs = Infinity (1st)

Team Horses: 383 yards / 3 TDs = 127.7 (9th)

Team NN: 491 yards / 3 TDs = 163.7 (5th)

CalAmari Cooper: 462 yards / 5 TDs = 92.4 (12th)

Nooni: 445 yards / 1 TDs = 445 (2nd)

Team ACL Tear: 509 yards / 5 TDs = 101.8 (11th)

I Got a Half Chubb: 503 yards / 4 TDs = 125.8 (10th)

Tompa Bay: 326 yards / 2 TDs = 163 (6th)

GRIDDY GANG: 281 yards / 1 TDs = 281 (4th)

Season Lineup Efficiency Average

Transaction Analysis

Best Transaction: Sony Michel, $2, Aross. Popped off and will start again this week.

Honorable Mention: Chiefs D/ST, $1, MW. Real nice week for em against the Broncos.

Worst Transaction: Mike Davis, $0, Dmichs. Less because of Mike himself, and more because it meant dropping Goedert who scored 25.5.

Honorable Mention: Kenyan Drake, $4, Dmichs. Weird to begin with, and now the dude is out for the season.

Record by PF Finish

1st: 13-0

2nd: 11-2

  1. JL (154 points)

  1. JL (12-1)

  3. Aross (8-5)
  4. Dmichs (7-6)
  5. NN (7-6)
  6. Folbe (7-6)
  7. Jason (6-7)
  8. Brad (5-8)
  9. MW (5-8)
  10. Bank (5-8)
  11. Nooni (3-10)
  12. Jart’s Sorry Excuse for a Team (6-7)

No debating.

Worst Possible Lineup

QB: Carson Wentz, 11.12 points, CJ

RB: Boston Scott, 0 points, Jase

RB: Darrell Henderson Jr, 0 points, Nooni

WR: Rashod Bateman, 0 points, Bank

WR: Jakobi Meyers, 0 points, NN

TE: Hunter Henry, 0 points, Jase

FLEX: Adam Thielen, 0.5 points, CJ

D/ST: Baltimore D/ST, 1 point, Bank

K: Tyler Bass, 1.5 points, Jart

Total Points: 14.12

Would it have beaten Jart: Felt like it

Best Possible Lineup

QB: Kyler Murray, 30.82 points, JL

RB: Javonte Williams, 26.8 points, MW

RB: Jonathan Taylor, 24.3 points, Dmichs

WR: Justin Jefferson, 30.1 points, Jase

WR: Diontae Johnson, 26.5 points, CJ

TE: George Kittle, 35.1 points, Brad

FLEX: Tee Higgins, 24.3 points, Aross

D/ST: Indianapolis D/ST, 16 points, Jase

K: Jake Elliott, 10 points, Nooni

Total Points: 223.92

Would it have beaten Dwitt in 2019: Yeah we do weekly at this point

Best Benchwarmer Lineup

QB: Taysom Hill, 20.66 points, NN

RB: Saquon Barkley, 10.4 points, Jart

RB: Tevin Coleman, 9.2 points, NN

WR: Elijah Moore, 17.6 points, Nooni (once again)

WR: Tyler Boyd, 11.0 points, MW

TE: Tyler Conklin, 9.1 points, CJ

FLEX: Deandre Hopkins, 10.2 points, CJ

D/ST: Multiple defenses, 9.0 points, JL/Nooni

K: N/A

Total Points: 97.16

How many teams would it have beaten this week: 4

Record by Max PF

In this segment, we will be looking at what everyone’s record would be if we played best ball - where the higher max PF each week (best lineup) would win the H2H matchup even if those players were on the bench. *Record tiebreaker was by Max PF possible on season*

  1. JL (12-1) No Change
  2. NN (8-5) +1 Win
  3. CJ (7-6) No Change
  4. Dmichs (7-6) No Change
  5. Brad (7-6) +2 Wins
  6. Aross (7-6) -1 Win
  7. Jart (6-7) No Change
  8. Bank (6-7) +1 Win
  9. Jason (5-8) -1 Win
  10. Folbe (5-8) -2 Wins
  11. MW (5-8) No Change
  12. Nooni (3-10) No Change

League Takes

Agree:

-NN winning it all

-I hate fantasy. This isn’t even a hot take. It’s the honest truth. I can’t stand it

-If I finish .500 this will be my best season yet! Watch out! I’m heating up! (Jason)

-What a week this will be

-MW is so cute

-Exciting week 14!

-Alex is the luckiest fantasy player ever

-JL has a really solid core 5 RB/WR/TE, but flex is weak. Depending on injuries, the winner this year will be NN or CJ.

Neutral:

-Super excited to sweat out everyone else's playoff scenarios that I don’t understand currently

-I want a billion dollars

Disagree:

-Alex winning the league

Jart’s Mailbag

If you were to redraft this year knowing everything you know now, but keeping in mind our league's crazy rb focus… What does your first round look like?

  1. Jonathan Taylor
  2. Austin Ekeler
  3. Joe Mixon
  4. Najee Harris
  5. Leonard Fournette
  6. Cooper Kupp
  7. James Conner
  8. Cordarelle Patterson
  9. Ezekiel Elliott
  10. D’Andre Swift
  11. Deebo Samuel
  12. Darrell Henderson

With all the injuries to running backs taken in spots 1-4 of this years draft, are these spots going to be seen as valuable next year? Or is there a change coming?

We will try to actually answer the question asked this week. I think yes. In some ways I’d like to think I pioneered some of that shift this year, trading down from 3 to 11 to get the guy I wanted and a slew of other draft assets (that turned into Tyreek Hill and Brandin Cooks). There is still a high value on these spots, as anyone who can consistently get you 20+ at RB (like Taylor, Ekeler, and Mixon have been) is insanely valuable. In many ways these RB injuries have highlighted just how important the position is, because it can get really thin really fast. I still expect these to be the first four spots chosen next year.

CFP predictions?

Georgia 27, Michigan 17. I think Michigan struggles to run against Georgia’s front 7, and while they hit some pass plays, it’s not enough. I expect to see some JT Daniels as well.

Alabama 35, Cincinnati 20. Alabama looked unbeatable last week, and there is just too much talent for pretty much any team in the country to keep up.

Georgia 34, Alabama 27. Georgia gets their revenge, Go Dawgs. No Metchie presents too big of an issue for Alabama, as Georgia plays better in the secondary and keys on Jameson Williams.

How did it feel rooting for Michigan?

Phenomenal question. Really weird. Multiple times I found myself celebrating a good Iowa play and then having to remind myself that I was rooting for Michigan. By the end though it was easy to root for them to pour it on and embarrass an Iowa team that had no right being in that game.

What is your projected playoff bracket?

  1. Jonah
  2. Alex
  3. CJ
  4. NN
  5. Dmichs
  6. Jart

What round does Allen Robinson go next year?

Considering that Justin Fields is the expected QB for the Bears next season, if Allen Robinson remains on the Bears, I would expect 4/5th Rd, given his upside and that Fields should make a jump heading into his second season. If Robinson goes elsewhere, it’ll be incredibly dependent on the QB and the WR room he is entering into. He still has the tools to be an elite WR, so I think anywhere between the 2nd and 10th rounds based on landing spot.

Who is everyone’s #1 family member?

  1. Alex: Lamar Jackson
  2. Brad: BMW
  3. Dmichs: Dak Prescott
  4. Folbe: Derrick Henry (doesn’t even matter that he’s not on his team)
  5. CJ: Nick Chubb
  6. JL: Joe Mixon
  7. NN: Najee Harris
  8. Jason: Justin Jefferson
  9. Nooni: Tyler LockettE
  10. Jart: Miles Sanders
  11. Bank: Hunter Renfrow
  12. MW: James Robinson

Who is your sleeper league winner player this year (an unexpected player that will put up numbers weeks 15-17 and propel his team to fantasy glory)?

It is going to be extremely tough to beat Jonah this year, and so whoever it is needs immense firepower to be able to pull it off. The best bet for that currently seems to be NN, given the incredible upside of Najee, Kupp, and Diggs. He seems like a pretty safe bet to make the playoffs, and from there he can easily put up big numbers as he has multiple times this season to get into contention.

Who’s got the biggest balls and is gonna get the final seed?

Honestly, Jart seems like the most likely pick here. So if I wasn’t writing about myself I would say me, and that is what I put in my playoff predictions. But I also know my team. So I think it ends up being someone else, and not Brad. Give me Alex in a wild end to the season.

Why?

This is the question I resonate most with this week. I don’t know. I don’t know why K9 didn’t make it to New York. I don’t know why Skip Bayless looks so good at 70. I don’t know why my team only scores 70 every week now. I don’t know why Jason’s best players always get hurt. I don’t know why Alex has such a good defense. I don’t know why Nooni trades away his best players. I don’t know why Lopey tries to tell us he is going to lose Week 16. I don’t know why the committee wants Alabama and Georgia to play in the natty every year. I don’t know why CJ’s team name is still Henry Ruggs. I just don’t know why.

Jart’s Mailbag Pt 2: Revenge of the Bag

How good is Aross’ team when healthy?

The most likely lineup in that scenario is:

QB: Lamar Jackson

RB: Dalvin Cook, Aaron Jones

WR: Tee Higgins, DK Metcalf

FLEX: AJ Brown

The weakness here is obviously the WRs, but overall this is probably a borderline top 5 lineup. A lot of boom or bust guys that could give Aross a legit shot to win the league, or get him embarrassed in the semis. Looks better than it did before the trades though.

We’re in a show for this week, will Nooni sneak into the playoffs?

MW clearly knows about as much about playoff possibilities as he does half his roster. Through no one’s fault but his own, Nooni is eliminated from playoff contention.

How did your finals go?

Good! Did well enough, enjoyed learning a lot, and now we chillin.

What’s the next big penny stock?

Rashaad. But if we are talking non-fantasy football investing, I’ve been a little out of the game the last 6 months, but I do still really like the long term projections for $CTXR into 2022. I have a real nice profit on it already so am just holding.

Who does Jart believe will play in and eventually win this years super bowl?

The AFC is such a cluster*frick* that I’m just gonna bet on the Chiefs coming out of there because they seem to be figuring it out now, even if they refuse to use Tyreek and Kelce and Mahomes plays like Jared Goof now. For the NFC, GB will obviously lose by 40 in the NFC Championship game, and I think that will be to the Buccaneers, because look I’m not gonna pick against Brady. So Chiefs-Bucs rematch, but Patty wins this one and relaunches his GOAT campaign despite a rough season.

Who’s gonna show the most heart this week? ❤️

Unsure if this meant what player or what team, so I will do both. For player, I like Joe Burrow. I don’t know if he’ll do that well fantasy wise, but that dude dislocated his finger in a tough loss last week, but he’s going right back out there this week looking for dubs. I respect it a lot if nothing else. For team, give me Alex’s. All year they’ve been hearing the noise, they’ve got some fresh blood in there, and they can go grab that first round bye to silence the noise.

Which player is the MVP for all of our teams? (Ex: mine is obviously Kupp)

NN: Taysom Hill. Guy is the heart and soul of NN’s team.

Alex: Lamar Jackson? Mostly because he’s the only guy that’s been around all year besides Dalvin, Fant, and AJB.

JL: Austin Ekeler. Shoulda drafted him Folbe.

CJ: Mark Andrews. Really embarrassed I took Pitts before him.

Dmichs: Jonathan Taylor. No explanation required

Folbe: Well it was Beta Metcalf, but now it’s Leonard Fournette.

Jart: Jalen Hurts. I hate him though. Same with Ja’Marr Chase. I actually hate my whole team except Davante Adams, Miles Sanders, and Saquon Barkley.

Jason: Justin Jefferson. It’s his GANG after all.

Bank: Hunter Renfrow. He is just so sexy amirite Bank? Maybe James Conner though.

Brad: Davante Ad… uh Cordarelle Patterson I guess, likely George Kittle by season’s end.

MW: Justin Herbert, one of the few guys left on his team that MW knows

Nooni: Alvin Kam… Michael Cart… Darrell Hender… Elijah Mo… um Chris Godwin?

What was the most impactful injury of the fantasy season?

Only two Jart Reports have been named off of a player injury - Derrick Henry (Interregnum) and Saquon Barkley (For Saquon <3). While we won’t quite know what Saquon’s injury meant coming off a 27 point game, we do know what Henry’s injury meant. Especially when you consider what the make-up of Jase’s squad was and how much JJeffs has come on while Kamara returns from injury, Jason would be the favorite to win the league right now had Derrick not gotten injured.

What were some of your favorite places to eat in Ann Arbor?

Frita Batidos is the undisputed GOAT, and I will go there any time I’m back. No Thai is a strong #2 for me, and I had it twice when I came home. I love bubble tea if that counts, and the new place where Bubble Island used to be is also quite good. I worked at Pieology for a summer, and even though it’s closed now, I have some great food memories from that time.

Favorite memory of Demaryius Thomas?

I mean the Tebow-Thomas OT winner is an all-timer, but I think what I always loved most was that Demaryius Thomas and Calvin Johnson, two prolific NFL receivers, both went to school at Georgia Tech, a school that only runs the ball.

Should we move to auction draft or keep snake draft?

Well I believe it is well known what a large proponent of the auction draft that I am, so I will take this opportunity to make my case. We are 11 players that are locked in all year round to football (+ Nooni) and we know what players we like and why we like em. Over this time we’ve developed relationships with our players and have come to love them. Think of a guy like Folbe who wanted nothing more than for Derrick Henry to be on his team, but he didn’t do well enough in a basketball tournament to get a football player? That just doesn’t make sense. The auction format allows us to put more stake in our drafts. We won’t be able to look back and say “oh well they just happened to have the __ overall pick and so those players fell into their lap”, like it did for MW the two years previous to this one with his First Round RB. With auction, it’s on you. Do your homework, get ready to play in a league that is absolutely elite. Auction is a needed next step for us to continue our evolution into the top 0.01% of leagues. Snake is stone age.

On To Week Fourteen!

The Scenarios:

Jonah:

Locked into the 1 seed and first round bye.

Alex:

With a win, 2 seed locked in and first round bye.

With a loss, a loss by CJ, Folbe, or NN clinches a playoff spot still. If all three of them win, it would come down to roto. Alex is currently 6 points behind the current 6 seed leader.

CJ:

With a win, playoffs guaranteed anywhere between the 2-4 seed (Dmichs trails by 20 PF currently).

With a loss, still a lock for the playoffs based on every calculation I can make, anywhere between the 3 and 6 seed.

Dmichs:

Same exact scenario as CJ, except a win guarantees 2 or 3 seed.

NN:

With a win, playoffs guaranteed, anywhere between the 3 and 5 seed.

With a loss, out unless Jart beats Folbe, but both score less than Noah (or Jart scores up to 13 points more and Jason scores up to 29 points more). This would give NN the 5 seed. He also can make it as the roto leader for the 6 seed. Noah is currently 7 points behind the current 6 seed leader.

Folbe:

With a win, playoffs guaranteed, anywhere between 3 and 5 seed

With a loss, out unless either NN loses while scoring less than Folbe and Jart does not outscore Folbe by 13. This would give Folbe the 5 seed. He also can make it as the roto leader for the 6 seed. Folbe is currently 8 points behind the current 6 seed leader, but a loss to Jart that gets Jart to the 5 seed would mean Folbe only trails roto leader (Brad) by 3 points currently.

Jart:

With a win, if he outscores Folbe by 12.6 and NN by 13.6 (in an NN loss), Jart is 5 seed. If either of those does not occur, needs to maintain roto lead, with the closest person currently 5 spots behind.

With a loss, needs to maintain roto lead, with the closest person currently 5 spots behind. Out if Dmichs or CJ ends up competing for the 6 seed.

Jason:

With a win, needs NN and Folbe to lose, and to outscore NN by 29.5, Folbe by 28.5, and Jart by 16.9. This would give Jason the 5 seed. He also can make it as the roto leader for the 6 seed. Jason is currently 9 points behind the current 6 seed leader, if Jart gets the 5 seed that would mean Jason only trails roto leader (Brad) by 4 points currently.

With a loss, can make it as the roto leader for the 6 seed. Jason is currently 9 points behind the current 6 seed leader, if Jart gets the 5 seed that would mean Jason only trails roto leader (Brad) by 4 points currently.

Bank:

By my best calculations, Bank has a 0.01% chance. To make it, he needs to lead in PF this week (and thus win), Jart to be the 5 seed, Brad to score 0 or 1 in roto, NN to score 0-2, Folbe to score 0-3, MW to score 0-4, and Jason to score 0-5.

Brad:

Win/loss is irrelevant. Needs either Jart to become the 5 seed, giving him the current roto lead to maintain, or to catch Jart (currently trails by 5 points) and to hold off other contenders.

MW:

Win/loss is irrelevant. Needs either Jart to become the 5 seed, meaning he only trails current leader by 3, or to catch Jart (currently trails by 8 points) and to hold off other contenders.

Nooni:

Mathematically eliminated from playoff contention.

This Week’s Matchups

Real Brothers vs Team Horses: A fun rematch, this is one of the few matchups where H2H is really a big difference maker in making the playoffs or not. A win seals a spot for Folbe, but a loss puts him in murky waters. Some key byes (Waddle, Sanders, Hurts) has these teams not quite at full strength, along with the continued injury to D’Andre Swift (and potentially Joe Burrow). Folbe is healthier right now, and Josh Allen is going to be playing pissed against a very vulnerable secondary. There’s a lot of question marks here (Hubbard, Penny), but Folbe seems like the safer pick with how Jart has been playing lately. We like Team Horses by 65.4.

Jart: “Oh boy oh boy oh boy. What a season it has been. So many ups and downs, it is fitting to play the guy I lost to in the biggest MNF sweat by .4 on a Hurts scramble on 4th down. I got nothing but respect for Team Horses. I wish Beta Metcalf was gonna be out there but excited to leave it all on the field this week. The Family knows the mission, and as long as we give it everything we’ve got, we can live with the outcome”

Folbe: “I hope you win Jarrett. I deserve nothing this year”

I Got a Half Chubb vs United Nations: Some of us are fans of the game. Some of us are fans of CJ. This writer is a fan of both. MW has assembled quite a bit of firepower at the top all of a sudden with Herbert and Javonte really coming on, but Frank Moreau doesn’t quite have it. For CJ, Rodgers against the Bears off a bye is sexy, Chubb-Dmont-Dhop-Andrews is a scary group, and the team needs a win to have a continued shot at the 2 seed. We like I Got a Half Chubb by 14.4.

MW: “Not focused on the matchup, focused on roto”

CJ: “Let’s ride into the playoffs 🦄”

NN vs Mike Williams WR1: Our future league winner against our playoff hopeful. While we like both to make the playoffs because Jart is a joke, there is way too much proven firepower on NN’s team that even Brad’s team that has been playing hot lately cannot keep up. We already know Najee popped off too, supporting NN coasting this week. We like NN by 26.6.

NN: “Thanks Najee”

Brad: “IM COMING FOR IT ALL- ‘Aidan Hutchinson’ - ‘Brad’”

Pray for Ridley vs Nooni: Two very uninspired teams who I expect to put forth a very uninspired effort. Nooni doesn’t even have a full roster at this point, so Bank will get the win and at least have some momentum going into the consolation playoffs. We like Pray For Ridley by 32.2.

Bank: “Me vs nooni is like watching msu play osu in football two studs but just doesn’t mean *poop* for the playoffs”

Nooni: “My matchup this week doesn’t matter”

Team Ross vs CalAmari Cooper: I woulda picked Dmichs, but after what Dalvin and Joseph did on TNF, it’s gotta change. This is statement week for Aross, and while that sucks for the rest of the league (if NN and Folbe win), there is not much we can do about it. We like Team Ross by 22.3. No Jonathan Taylor = No Win.

Alex: “Good win Dmichs really want this one as I can’t watch football next Sunday unless I leave LA at 6am which I’ll do regardless”

Dmichs: “Alex is going down this week despite his early lead, I promise”

GRIDDY GANG vs Team ACL Tear: After the first quarter of TNF, it looked like Jase was gonna score 200. Now we’re left with some question marks on his side, as Kamara+Burkhead is probably the most intriguing “who knows what to expect” backfield duo this week. There is simply too much on JL’s side regardless of who he starts at FLEX, and Jason’s playoff hopes ultimately come up short, with the injury to Derrick Henry being the easy thing to point back to as where it all fell apart. We still love GRIDDY GANG, but we like Team ACL Tear by 27.4 this week.

JL: “Need a Jase W”

Jase: “I’m so glad I get to play Jonah twice. Really sums up my luck”

Best Player at Each Position

QB: Matt Stafford, NN’s Bench

RB: Dalvin Cook, Aross (is this cheating?)

WR: Cooper Kupp, NN

TE: Travis Kelce, Dmichs

D/ST: Whoever he starts, JL

K: Brandon McManus, FA

Family Award

For the way the boys have rallied together and put up some big performances, Brad is our winner for the Family Award. If the squad rolls out matching shoulder harnesses, I like Aross to win the award next week.
